c74object.name: hoa.stereo~
c74object.digest: An ambisonic decoder for stereophonic system.
c74object.description:
hoa.stereo~
decodes an ambisonic soundfield for stereophonic system. First argument is the order of the ambisonic soundfield, second and third arguments are the angles of the loudspeakers in degrees (default 30° and 330°). It use fractional orders and inPhase optimization to keep a perceptive linear panning between the two louspeakers, send "infos" message to print the current configuration of the object in Max window.

metadatalist.metadata: hoa.library by Julien Colafrancesco, Pierre Guillot, Eliott Paris.

objarg.digest: Set the left loudspeaker position in degree (default 60°) if a third argument is passed to the object, adapt the both otherwise.

entry.name: fractional order
entry.description: hoa.stereo~ works for all the loudspeakers positions and all the ambisonic orders. Higher is the order, better is the restitution so it seems that for a "classical" stereo (60°), the best order is 7. For a lower distance between loudspeakers, you should use higher orders to increase the restitution. Reciprocally, you can use lower orders to preserve the cpu if the distance between the loudspeakers is higher.
